line.en: 'Ta-dah! Look Amane, check this out!'
'...Is that a glider?'
'Yeah it is. This gives us wings.'
'You can fly with this?'
'Just imagine, us flying free through the great\nbig sky...'
'Ughh... now I don't feel so good. I'm no good\nwith heights.'
'...You have absolutely no romantic sense.'
'Don't you get what I'm saying? The great big sky\nis romance! And wings? Freedom!'
'We have to chase our dreams.'
'Life is short...'
'...I don't mind chasing them, but I want to keep\nmy feet on the ground.'
'Check this out too!'
'The Morning Glory!'
It's a photo Isuka found in this old garage.
There is a strangely shaped cloud in it.
She looked at the photo with great fascination,\nas if she wished to fly through the sky without\nrelying on the power of a glider.
Just like in the picture, above the clouds.
'I want to soar through the passage of clouds\ntogether, Amane...'
'It just might become a great memory, a wonderful\nshimmering, first-class one even!'
I don't like heights.
It's so scary my legs shake.
Not to mention flying in the sky... above the\nclouds and all, just imagining it makes me\ntremble.
But why...
I would see those sights with Isuka.
When I thought about it like that, it didn't seem\nso bad.
No, I thought it might not actually be a bad\nidea.
'But isn't this glider kind of old? Can it fly\nlike this?'
'Don't be silly, Amane. We can bring it back to\nlife with our hands.'
'That's more dramatic!'
'You think so?'
It seemed like such a difficult task to restore a\nglider that had been thrown out and abandoned.
And more than that...
As far as I have seen, there is no evidence of a\nphenomenon like the Morning Glory in Kazegaura\nwithin the past twenty years.
For the sake of argument, even if it flew, it\nwould be hard to imagine this phenomenon would\nhappen for us this time.
'You don't need to worry.'
I was thinking, 'I doubt she can do that.
But at the same time, I also thought...
If Isuka says she can do it, maybe it's possible.
It could have been the first time since I was\nborn that I thought like that.
I was in denial because I approached it\nemotionally, and not logically.
From that day on, Isuka and I aimed for the\nskies.
With our wings, we would soar through the passage\nof clouds.
The days I spent with Isuka glittered with\nrainbow colors and before I knew it, I was\ndazedly chasing dreams with her.
But, one day... Isuka was suddenly gone.
Me and...
So many unfulfilled promises were left behind.
The world around me lost all color and became\nmonotone once again.
When I'd look out the window I would see a sky so\nblue it hurt my eyes, and in it a cumulonimbus\ncloud towering above everything.
One aspect of this season is the panoramic sky.\nIt is magnificent in its scale. And it makes you\nfeel it.
In that, I...
I think of White wings riding the winds...
Today there are thin, scattered clouds. It just\nmight be warm today.
'I wanna fly, damnit...'
I am impatient and only able to lift my eyes up,\noverwhelmed by the size of the sky.
'Aoi.'
It was Kotori who called me as I looked up to the\nsky from the window.
'What are you looking at the sky for?'
'I was thinking this is perfect soaring weather.'
She comes to my side and looks up from the window\ntoo.
'Good weather, isn't it. Looks a little hot\nthough.'
'Don't say that.'
The restrictions on the air conditioner in the\nclassroom were lifted the other day and it is\npleasantly cool.
Looking up at the blue sky from the right place\nis as refreshing as it gets.
But if I were to open this window, a hot breeze\nwould surely waft its way in.
'Summer has come again, huh...'
Looking out the window, Kotori mutters.
'Ahh.'
Summer has come around again and I still can't\nfly.
'Ah, I found you! What are you two doing?'
Ageha came into the classroom.
It was after school and there were only a few\nothers around aside from us.
'You're gonna go, right? To see Akari?'
'Oh that's right. That's why I came to get Aoi.'
'All right, you wanna get going?'
'Nope, permission denied!'
'What, why?! There are plenty of members for the\nclub.'
'If you have no supervisor, I cannot acknowledge\nyour club.'
'Ughhh...'
Kotori groaned and glared at Akari.
'So, if there was a teacher who would stand in as\nour club supervisor, we could get back to our\nclub activities?'
'...I can't promise anything definite.'
'Why not?'
'You need a certified mentor to operate a\nglider.'
'But there isn't anyone like that at this\nschool.'
'Just for the sake of argument, even if you were\nto get approval for the club, without a certified\nmentor, the teachers wouldn't allow it.'
She'd poked a sore spot.
Until last year Yamanobe-sensei, a glider\namateur, worked here.
The one who had a certification was Amane\nMochizuki and she was the one who was actually in\ncharge.
We don't say anything back and just keep our\nmouths shut.
'Okay, so if we have a supervisor and a certified\nmentor, then there is no problem, right?'

'If you can satisfy those conditions, we, the
student council, would recognize it as a club
activity and you would have the support of the
school.'
'Even though we were the ones that caused...all\nthat trouble?'
I asked cautiously and Akari glared at me.
'...I thought that problem had already been dealt\nwith.'
'I think any further punishment would be\nunreasonable.'
Akari spoke in a decisive tone and then went out\ninto the hallway.
'Just as you'd expect, that new student council\npresident is tough.'
'Ugh... let's go. We've got a strategy meeting.'
'Ah, welcome back.'
'Welcome back.'
'Hey there.'
'Heya.'
When we got back to the Flying Fish Manor, Asa\nand Yoru were there to meet us.
'How did it go?'
'Sorry. No good.'
'Oh, I see...'
'At the very least we have to find a teacher who\nwill be our supervisor.'
'We haven't got a room for our club or a\nglider... which is kinda crucial. Which means\nwe're going to keep on going as a fan club...'
Everyone's shoulders stoop a bit when Yoru says\nthat.
She's right. Right now we're not a soaring club.\nWe're a soaring fan club.
Without a place to actually do club activites, or\na glider even, we're just a fan club meeting to\ntalk about this and that.
Why had it gotten like this?
The cause goes back to summer of last year...\nwith Amane, we had our sights set on the Morning\nGlory.
When summer ended, Amane retired from the club\nand stopped coming to school.
But even so, we intended to continue our club\nactivities.
Next time we will fly the Morning Glory...
So we swore, and when we set out it was like our\ndeparture was crushed by that incident.
Under the pretense that we had too few members in\nthe club, Tobioka abolished the Soaring Club\nwithout warning and tried to demolish our garage.
To stop him, we stood at the garage in protest.
Since Tobioka was forcing his way ahead and we\nwere rushed, we didn't have any other way to stop\nhim.
That said, standing there we had a very small\nchance of undermining the demolition.
Even though we knew it was pointless, we bought\nourselves time while we appealed to the school\nand were rejected time and time again.
Anyway, the third day we stood at the garage, for\nsome reason the demolition was halted and finally\nrepealed.

At first I thought it was a lie to get us to come
out, but after that the demolition never happened
and the garage stands behind the school, deserted
and vacant.
People would hear about the uproar we made, about\nhow the out-of-control Soaring Club protested.
The school board caught wind of what we'd done,\nabout how we halted the tyranny of Tobioka.
Blah, blah, etc., etc. I'm not lying, but I'm not\nsure it's the whole truth either.
Tobioka and his party cut down the opposition\nfrom the other teachers and tried to force the\ndemolition. That much is true, or so I hear.
Regardless of the big problem that occurred, a\nnumber of teachers showed their sympathy.
Kotori, Ageha and I were handed suspensions as a\npunishment for the fuss we had made.
After that, without enough members, the Soaring\nClub was reduced to being a society.
Also the garage was declared off limits and our\nglider was confiscated.

I heard that they were going to build a student
dorm at the garage site, but a different place
was secured and is already being used by this
year's new students.
That is why we had no place to do club activities\nand no glider. We were just a group of friends\nand not a club.
Since then, the garage has been locked and our\nglider abandoned.
'...Damn, if no one else is going to use it, they\nought to let us.'

'That's no good on the teachers' end though. If
the teachers just give into to any old student
demonstration then they'll have their own
problems.'
'...We had good times back then, didn't we...'
I murmur deeply.
Since then, a year has passed and we have become\nthird years.
What can I say... I think we were young.
'We had just lost Amane and we were impatient,\nhuh...'
Kotori and I laugh spontaneously at what Ageha\nmuttered.
We were aware Amane was going to retire, but\nbefore we knew it, she was gone.
She left us, before we could even process how we\nfelt about having to deal with that demolition\nmess.
What Ageha said about us being impatient... it\nperfectly expresses how we felt then.
'So that was the infamous garage occupation\nincident?'
'Yeah, it's something which will continue to live\non in Keifuu Academy history.'
'Yeah the story might even be told and passed on\nfor posterity...'
'Oh, shush! We just couldn't be obedient, faced\nwith an unreasonable society.'
By the way, Asa and Yoru are still just first\nyears.
Twin sisters who just came to this school this\nyear.
They're also tenants of the Flying Fish Manor,\nand granddaughters of the school board's\nchairman.
But thinking about it that way, I can't look them\nin the face after the stain we left on the\nschool's history.
'Hey, your grandfather has authority over this\nstuff. Can't he do something?'
'Uhhh...'
'...you'd actually ask that?'
'No way, it's just a joke! Right, Kotori?'
'Yeah of course! A joke...'
Those two recently joined our Soaring Society.
In fact, I hear they were on the bank of the lake\na year ago on the morning the Morning Glory\nappeared.
From Windmill Hill, they happened to witness the\nglider flying the over passage of clouds.
That was how they got interested in gliders, but\nwhen they enrolled in the school, the Soaring\nClub had been abolished and the garage sealed.
They recently moved into the Flying Fish Manor\nand met us, which is how they came to know about\nthe Soaring Club.

Thanks to them, we meet the regulation club size
again, and so today we went to see Akari so we
could appeal to return to our club activities.
But...
We were rejected and dragged ourselves here in\nlow spirits.
'If we don't do something and get back to our\nclub activities... we'll never get our garage or\nglider back.'
That's true.
The conditions for us to get back our garage and\nthe glider stored inside were that we return to\nour club activities.
This included the winch installed in the runway.
All of that was considered 'equipment of the\nSoaring Club' that we, the fan club, were\nforbidden to use.
On the other hand, if we can just get our\nactivities recognized, we can get it all back.
'But hey, it's good that Akari is the new student\ncouncil president.'
It really was quite a sight when in last month's\nelection Akari was elected student council\npresident.
'How's that? She's so strict, so straight-laced.\nEverything's got to be by the books with her. How\ncan we get at her?'
'That's exactly why. Because she's fair. If we're\nin the right then she'll be on our side.'
'Yeah. If this were a regular student council\npresident, when Tobioka-sensei was glaring down\non us we would have already been done.'
By not refusing us outright, Akari left us a path\nto tread.
Despite the fact that we caused that trouble at\nthe garage.

If it had been last year's student council
president, we'd have been told 'Sorry, the
teacher's word is final.' That would have been
the end of it.
But anyway, it doesn't matter at all.
And that idiot Masatsugu... just for running he\ngot the sympathy vote and was elected secretary.
I've known the guy since we were children, and\nwondering if we're okay with him leaves me with\nextreme anxiety.
'Eh, whatever. We're doing all we can to get\nreacknowledged as a club.'
'We just need a supervisor and a certified\nmentor.'
'It's not gonna be easy, but let's try to find\nsomeone.'
'Asa, Yoru, you girls too, please!'
'Okay!'
'Sure.'
Seeing the path we need to tread raised our\nspirits.
'All right then, let's get to today's business.'
'...Is this the 'winglet?''
'I had thought it was just a cool decoration.'
Asa said that as she looked at the diagram spread\nout on the table.
'Every part of the glider's structure has a\npurpose.'
'Because there's no room for dead weight on\nsomething that flies.'
Amane devoted years to drawing that diagram and\nleft it behind for us.
There is one thing we can do without a glider or\nplace to do our club activities.
That is understanding this diagram and carefully\nsimulating the glider's build.

If we were to really try and make one of these,
what sort of processes would be required? What
materials would we need? What problems might
arise?
How can we reduce the time required for\nconstruction? How can the problems be solved?
To understand the glider, it was useful to study\nthe diagram and understand the function of each\npart.
'You seniors are amazing. I'll do my best too...'
'It's because we haven't had anything else to do\nall year.'
'We've done pretty much only this. Working\ntirelessly the whole time.'
Deepening our knowledge this year has made these\ngiant wings that soar through the sky feel much\ncloser to us.
Though we once had to rely heavily on Amane, I\nnow think we needed to learn more in order to be\nindependent.
'If we hadn't been downgraded to a society we\nprobably wouldn't have ever done this.'
'Yeah, you're right. When I think about it that\nway, this isn't really a detour, is it?'
'Yup. It's all connected to our dream. Right,\nKotori?'
She nods deeply.
'Someday let's build this glider. And then fly\nit.'
'In that great big sky...'
Everyone nodded at her words.
No one here doubted that dream.
'Hey, we're going this weekend, right?'
'Yeah we've already agreed to.'
'Where are you going?'
'To the gliding range. We're going to go get some\npractice in so Aoi doesn't get rusty.'
'You're gonna fly a glider!?'
'Yep. You girls want to come too?'
'Yeah! Yeah! Right, Yoru!'
'...If I feel up to it.'
From here, if you ride the train for about two\nhours there is a gliding range.
You can practice flying a gilder there if you pay\nfor it.
What I'm hiding is that I've been going there all\nyear, getting practice in.
And the other day I got qualified... every\npilot's dream!
'Then it's decided. This Sunday we'll all go to\nthe gliding range.'
At any rate, since it costs money, now that I am\nqualified I haven't been going as much.
We can't do anything with our club so going to\nthe gliding range has been the only fun we've\nhad.
The following week we searched the school for a\nteacher who would become our supervisor.
'I'm sorry. I understand how you all feel, but\nI'm already the supervisor for the drama club.'
'Drama doesn't suit you at all!'
'Yeah!'
'Quiet down. I may be a teacher here, but my true\nambition was to be an artist.'
'Drama is great. Give up on this glider business\nand join the drama club.'
'No way!'
'I refuse!'
'...That kinda hurts.'
When the teacher we'd hurt left, our shoulders\nslumped.
And what's more is that they are my homeroom\nteacher.
'I guess it's no use...'
'It's not going well at all.'
Making the rounds, talking to all the teachers\nwho seemed like they might help us out is getting\nus nowhere.
Asa and Yoru looked around for a supervisor\nbefore they joined the club too.
At the time there was no teacher on the staff who\ncould take our supervisor's place and our chances\nwere slim.
'She's pressuring them behind our backs'
Kotori snorts, her face full of anger.
'Yeah, they looked so troubled when they turn us\ndown.'
'...Maybe we can call in someone certified from\noutside the school.'
'We would still need a supervisor.'
Yesterday when we went to the gliding range I\nchecked with a soaring group that was there and\nsome of them had some interest.

The glider would cost money, we would be limited
by places we can have club activities and the
average age of the people at the gliding range is
frightfully high.
If someone young could instruct us, there were\nplenty of people willing to pitch in and help.
Incidentally, young girls who participate\nproactively are rare too.
'Be that as it may, the commute going one-way is\na real pain...'
'Oh yeah, you're right.'
But it was still better than aiming at nothing.
While we were saying these things and walking in\nthe hallway...
'You kids haven't given up?'
'Tobioka!'
'...Sensei.'
Ageha immediately corrects Kotori, adding the\nteacher's title.
As if he had been waiting for us, Tobioka stepped\ninto our path.
'I heard you have been going around making\nunreasonable requests to the teachers.'
'It's not an unreasonable request.'
'Why don't you just give up? There's no teacher\nwho will help notoriously bad students like you.'
Tobioka speaks triumphantly.
He brings that up at every opportunity like he\nholds a grudge against us for halting the\ndemolition of the garage.
'The best you can do is try.'
'We're going to do that whether you say so or\nnot.'
Unamused, Tobioka looked right into Kotori's face\nand snorted, 'Hmph.
Then he starts walking.
When he passed us, he said,
'It is a waste of hard work anyways.'
He whispered to himself just loudly enough to be\nheard and then disappeared on the other side of\nthe hallway.
'What was that!'
'...ehh. Don't pay any attention to him. He's\njust trying to upset us.'
'But what's all that about wasted hard work?'
'I'll say it again, he just wants to put pressure\non us. Come on, let's go!'
'Let's go home.'
But it was no mere threat.
A few days later...
'...or so I heard.'
'Is that for real?!'
'Yeah, I heard it is.'
'Yeah...'
The information Masatsugu brought was shocking.
Among the teachers there is movement once again\nto demolish the garage.
He heard that they had been discussing about what\nto do with 'that abandoned garage that no one is\nusing.
It seems that this time it was not Tobioka who\nsuggested it, but of course he is helping the\nplan move along.
'What's gonna happen to the glider? If we lose\nthe garage, we lose our place to store it.'
'They said something about that too. If I recall,\nthey said they would donate it to the city\nmuseum.'
'Don't give away our stuff!'
'Ugh, don't tell me.'
The Soaring Club flew that glider twenty-seven\nyears ago and photographed the Morning Glory.\nThey made that glider themselves.

That's why it wouldn't be wrong to say it belongs
to the Soaring Club even though it was actually
an abandoned glider restored, resurrected even,
by Amane and them.
Now the main wings and such were all things that\nwe rebuilt.
Most of that expense were paid for by Amane\nherself.
'Homemade gliders are rare. I heard the museum\nreally wants it.'
'That's not something to decorate a museum with.\nIt still flies. It's still in use!'
'...Don't look so scared. I thought you'd say\nthat. That's why I came here to tell you all of\nthis.'
'Sorry...'
Masatsugu, through his work with the student\ncouncil, happened to hear these things.
Then he came running to tell us.
'Don't tell anyone you heard it from me. I don't\nwant Akari to hate me.'
'Sure, we understand. Thanks Ma-bou.'
'Yeah. Make the best of it. And don't come crying\nto me later.'
'What are we going to do, Aoi?'
The gears in my head started turning as I\npondered about what to do next.
The first thing that came to mind was to go to\nthe garage and stand in protest, the same as last\ntime.
While I considered that, I looked at Kotori.
'(If we do the same thing again our punishment\nwill be worse than last time. I can handle it but\nhow about her...)'
Last year when we were suspended from school and\nthe situation became 'a situation,' they called\nour guardians.
Me and Ageha, got a really harsh lecture but it\nwas just about the mess we had caused and they\nunderstood how we felt.
But at Kotori's house it was different.
Her parents were shocked that the precious little\ngirl they had raised would do such a thing.
Kotori won't say anything, but I heard from\nHibari-san that they nearly withdrew Kotori from\nthe school.
Kotori was really anxious about worrying her\nparents.
'At the very least we have to get our glider\nback...'
'Yeah. That's the plane we flew with Amane. That\nglider is important!'
Dark expressions settled over us as we brooded\nover these thoughts and from the hallway\nresounded the heavy thuds of footsteps.
They continued until there was a sudden and\nfierce knock at the door. Without pausing for a\nreply, the door opened.
'Big news! Big news!'
Ageha changed her expression and plunged into the\nroom.
'Yeah, the garage. We just heard.'
'Huh? What are you talking about?'
'It's not about that? We just heard from\nMa-bou...'
'That can wait!'
Ageha said, interrupting me.
'Amane is coming back!'
'Huh?'
'What do you mean?'
'She's coming back to Keifuu Academy as a special\nclass teacher!'
Sure enough, like a bolt of lightning from a\nclear blue sky, that was big news.
